channel.title: Anna Faris Is Unqualified
channel.itunes:summary:
Not-great-relationship advice from completely unqualified Hollywood types.
I am a solid 3.4 student with a major in English from the University of Washington. I've also been asked what my SAT score was and it was 1060. It only took five years of dorm/rave life for me to accrue the life knowledge I have received. I’m a Sagittarius, which means I’m super creative and stubborn; but there are walls I need to break down because I always want to leap over the boundaries that make me climb ladders and roofs. I’m agreeable and delightful. I also have incredible leadership skills and following abilities. And, I have 20/20 vision so I’m an eagle eye. I could not love all of you more and please e-mail me at questions@annafarisisunqualified.com with your pressing relationship questions.
channel.itunes:author: Unqualified Media

item.title: ep 115: Zach Braff
item.description:
This week’s episode of Unqualified starts off with a very special announcement from Sim and Amy as well as some incredible feedback from our dear listeners. 
 
Then, the wonderfully talented actor and filmmaker Zach Braff (SCRUBS, GARDEN STATE) joins us (15:22)! First, Anna pitches a new podcast idea to Zach, “Bros Before Hoes” (16:02) and Zach gives us his thoughts on tattoos (18:54). After that, they play a round of “Just Answer” (23:44) and have a conversation on dating within the entertainment industry (30:00). Later, Anna asks Zach what woman he would want to trade places with for a day (35:12) and they discuss what it’s like to work alongside difficult actors (42:52). Finally, they call Annalisa, whose fiancé has been spending time with a friend’s hot ex-girlfriend (49:12), and Liz, whose boyfriend seems to have a wandering eye online (1:11:26). Listen now!
 
This episode is sponsored by Le Tote and Squarespace. Le Tote is a service that delivers brand new clothing to your front door and Squarespace is the all-in-one solution for anyone looking to create a beautiful website.
 
Check out our deals!
 
For 50% off your first order, go to letote.com and use promo code UNQUALIFIED at checkout
 
To save 10% off your first purchase of a website or domain at squarespace.com, use offer code: UNQUALIFIED

item.title: ep 114: Macaulay Culkin
item.description:
The one and only Macaulay Culkin (HOME ALONE, MY GIRL) joins Anna and Sim for this week’s episode of Unqualified! Anna starts off the show by asking Macaulay what qualities he looks for while searching for a romantic partner (8:52) followed by a round of “Just Answer” (13:24). Then, Macaulay reminisces on the time he lost his virginity (21:10) and reveals his favorite meal to cook while stoned (22:04). After that, Anna gives us her renowned voice performance of a Washington state pornstar (24:39). Later, they call Jenny, who is unsure if she should invite her estranged father to her wedding (31:58). Tune in & don’t forget to listen to Anna on Macaulay’s podcast, Bunny Ears!
 
This episode is sponsored by The Good Fight on CBS All Access, Hubble Contacts, Blue Apron and Peloton. The Good Fight is a CBS All Access original series featuring strong female characters taking on-real world problems and relatable human struggles while learning a lot about themselves in the process. Hubble Contacts is the company that ships affordable and comfortable contacts directly to your door. Blue Apron is a meal delivery service that provides US residents with pre-portioned meals with recipes to subscribers and Peloton is a cutting-edge, indoor cycling bike that brings the studio experience to your home.

item.title: ep 113: Heather Graham
item.description:
The incredible actress, writer and director Heather Graham is on this week’s episode of Unqualified! In this episode, Heather talks about the rewarding experience of directing her first film (6:10) and the group gets into a powerful conversation on sexism in the entertainment industry (8:02) before revealing their favorite romantic comedy guilty pleasures (13:50).

Then, Heather plays a round of deal-breakers (16:40) and the gals tell us what qualities they look for in a partner (19:28). After that, Heather and Anna discuss the societal pressures and expectations of being female (32:48) followed by Anna’s recollections of becoming a mother in the Hollywood spotlight (38:05).

Later, they call Mira (46:40), who is getting bullied at work by women who are jealous of her job title, and Justina (1:00:00), who is in a disagreement with her husband over what to name their baby on-the-way. Tune in and enjoy!

This episode is sponsored by MeUndies, True Religion, The Good Fight on CBS All Access, and ZipRecruiter. MeUndies is the company that brings softer-than-soft, super affordable underwear right to your door. True Religion uses precision and fit make them the most comfortable jeans on the market. item.title: ep 112: Olivia Cooke & Anya Taylor-Joy
item.description:
The lovely Olivia Cooke (BATES MOTEL, THOROUGHBREDS) and Anya Taylor-Joy (SPLIT, THOROUGHBREDS) join us for this week’s brand new episode of Unqualified! To begin, Anna and Olivia talk about the realities of life as an actor (6:38) before Anya arrives to join the party (10:20). Then, Olivia and Anya discuss working on-set with each other as two female leads and the outrageous questions they are asked by the press (11:05).

Next, Olivia and Anya play a round of “Friendship Deal-Breakers” (15:16) and then answer some more deal-breakers in a new segment called “You’re Dating An American” (22:05). After that, the group has a very important conversation on female empowerment (34:05). Later, they call Maddie, whose roommate is dating other guys behind her boyfriend’s back (38:34), and Maxie, whose boyfriend is making no effort to move out of his parents house (48:50). Tune in and enjoy!

This episode is sponsored by Blue Apron, Beachbody On Demand, and Squarespace. Blue Apron is a meal delivery service that provides US residents with pre-portioned meals with recipes to subscribers, Beach Body On-Demand is an on-demand fitness streaming service that gives you unlimited access to all sorts of world-class workouts, and Squarespace is the all-in-one solution for anyone looking to create a beautiful website.

item.title: ep 111: Allison Janney Returns!
item.description:
She’s back! This week, the brilliant Allison Janney (I, TONYA, MOM) returns to Unqualified for an unforgettable episode. 
First, Anna and Allison reminisce on the time they photo-bombed a group portrait celebrating TV writer Chuck Lorre (4:38). Then, Allison reveals the most stressful part of awards season (6:45) and Cherry, from BWT, makes a cameo to interview Allison on the red carpet (9:00). 
 
Next, Anna and Sim do a few rounds of dealbreakers - first, with the cast of Paramount Network’s “Heathers” (19:50) and then with Allison (36:04). After that, Sim and Allison battle it out in a game called “Who Knows Anna Faris Best?” (46:00) before calling Sophie, whose boyfriend’s mom dislikes her because she doesn’t come from money (1:02:35). 
The episode ends with a sweet moment between Anna and Allison and a duet of “Take Me Back to Manhattan” that you won’t want to miss (1:22:00). Tune in!
 
This episode is sponsored by ZipRecruiter, Le Tote and Honey. ZipRecruiter lets you post your job to over 100 of the internet’s leading job boards with just 1 click so you can find qualified candidates within minutes of posting, Le Tote Select is a service that delivers brand new clothing to your front door, and Honey is a browser extension that automatically finds and applies coupon codes at checkout with a single click.
 
Don’t forget to watch Heathers on Paramount Network, premiering March 7 at 10/9c!
 
Check out our deals!
 
To post your job on ZipRecruiter for free, go to ziprecruiter.com/unqualified
 
For 50% off your first order, go to letote.com and use promo code UNQUALIFIED at checkout
 
To add Honey to your browser for free, visit joinhoney.com

item.title: ep 110: Tom Segura
item.description:
Talented stand-up comedian and writer Tom Segura (NETFLIX’S DISGRACEFUL, MOSTLY STORIES) is on this week’s episode of Unqualified! First, Anna and Tom discuss the differences between being an actor and a comedian (5:32) and Tom tells us his favorite thing to do after a show (10:30). Then, they have an insightful discussion on overcoming self-doubt (15:00), Anna talks about how the plot of House Bunny was developed (21:25), and Sim reflects on how he and Anna first met (29:40). After that, Tom answers some wild deal-breakers (39:27) and Anna reveals her ideal acting roles (54:20).
 
Later, they call Laura (1:01:05), who is struggling with her boyfriend’s interest in having a threesome, and Megan, whose new boyfriend won’t stop talking about his past sexual experiences with other women. Anna, Sim and Tom give some amazing advice. Tune in and enjoy!
 
Go to crowdrise.com/unqualified to donate to GAPPS today. Help increase awareness and fund research towards preventing prematurity and stillbirth in newborn children and you may win a trip to LA to hang out with Anna and the Unqualified crew!
 
This episode is sponsored by Hubble Contacts, True Religion, Blue Apron and The Good Fight. Hubble Contacts is the company that ships affordable and comfortable contacts directly to your door, True Religion uses precision and fit make them the most comfortable jeans on the market, Blue Apron is a meal delivery service that provides US residents with pre-portioned meals with recipes to subscribers and The Good Fight is a CBS All Access original series featuring strong female characters taking on-real world problems and relatable human struggles while learning a lot about themselves in the process. 
 
Check out our deals!
 
To get your first 2 weeks of incredible and affordable contacts for FREE, go to www.hubblecontacts.com
 
For $50 off a pair of True Religion Jeans, use code “unqualified” at checkout!
 
Get $30 off your first order with Blue Apron free by visiting www.blueapron.com/unqualified
 
For a free trial of CBS All Access, go to www.cbs.com/unqualfied to catch up on The Good Fight - Season 2 premieres March 4!

item.title: ep 109: Jena Friedman/Caller Updates -- did Dave's relationship "expire"? Plus, more on GAPPS with Anna's dad!
item.description:
This week on Anna Faris is Unqualified, Anna, Sim and Jack Faris chat with Jena Friedman (THE DAILY SHOW, SOFT FOCUS WITH JENA FRIEDMAN) about her new Adult Swim special (8:58) before Anna hands off the reins of the interview to a VERY serious journalist. (13:45)

After the break, they call Dr. Craig Rubens to talk about premature births and how GAPPS is helping to prevent them (23:25) before getting an update from past caller Dave about his girlfriend who put an expiration date on their relationship (41:30). All that and more on an all new Unqualified!

Go to crowdrise.com/unqualified to donate to GAPPS today. Help increase awareness and fund research towards preventing prematurity and stillbirth in newborn children and you may win a trip to LA to hang out with Anna and the Unqualified crew!

item.title: 2017 Memorable Moments Vol. 3
item.description:
This week, we're looking back at some out our favorite moments in Unqualified 2017! Featuring incredible conversations, awesome games, calls from listeners, and unexpected cameos from the most memorable interviews of the year!

In this episode there are clips from our chats with Malin Akerman (3:14), RuPaul (20:17), Nick Kroll (22:38), Thomas Middleditch (25:12), Terry Crews (26:40), Eva Longoria (1:00:00), Sharon Stone (1:08:10), Lee Daniels (1:16:03), Maria Bamford (1:22:42), Andy Cohen (1:27:31), Lake Bell (1:32:38), Emma Roberts (1:55:45), and an amazing song from Jack Johnson (2:34:12).

RuPaul gives Anna and Sim their drag names, Lee Daniels auditions Anna for Empire, Terry Crews on masculinity in society today, Emma Roberts saves the show when the listeners calls fall through, we talk #MeToo (2:08:00), Sim and Amy ask Anna to officiate their wedding (2:32:23), and so much more!

This episode is sponsored by Zola Uber. Zola, the wedding company that’ll do anything for love, is reinventing the wedding planning and registry experience with a free suite of planning tools. Uber is a ride-sharing app that provides convenient, safe, comfortable, affordable transportation anywhere you want to go

 

Check out our deals!

For a $50 credit, visit zola.com/unqualified

item.title: ep 99: USC Sorority Night! Anna "swipes right" with "Tinder Live's" Lane Moore and the girls of Gamma Phi Beta
item.description:
From inside the chapter room of the Gamma Phi Beta sorority house at USC, Anna and Sim discuss Tinder Live with comedian Lane Moore (3:10)! We can't tell guys how to make the perfect Tinder profile but Lane can tell you how NOT to do it.

Then we play a round of Deal Breakers (35:34) and chat with some of the girls in the house! Peyton talks about hooking up without falling in love (42:00) and Bree tells us about guys not expecting her to be intelligent (52:00). Then we wrap up the show by giving advice to Rachel on how to handle a long distance relationship that's ended (54:10).

This episode is sponsored by Texture. Texture is an app that provides unlimited access to over 150 magazine subscriptions for a monthly rate.

item.title: An Unqualified Engagement / Premiere of “Javier” Es Qualified
item.description: Happy Thanksgiving, dear listeners! Given the holiday this week, we wanted to share something a little different and close to our hearts. First, Anna interviews Sim and Amy about how they met and fell in love (and what misconception Amy had about Anna!). They share their engagement story and Sim asks Anna a very important question. After that, get ready to laugh with the premiere of a new Unqualified spin-off: "Javier" Es Qualified! In it, Sim and Javier Bardem (a.k.a UCB alum/improv genius Brad Morris) offer relationship advice to callers struggling with modern dating issues. You definitely won't want to miss Javier's unique take! Enjoy!

item.title: ep 95: Arielle Kebbel/#MeToo - sexual harassment in Hollywood and beyond
item.description:
This week, Anna and Sim sit down with actress Arielle Kebbel (MIDNIGHT, TEXAS, JOHN TUCKER MUST DIE) and weigh in on an important topic at the forefront of current events: #MeToo. They begin with a call to Frances (16:30), whose experiences with sexual harassment have left her scarred, and uncertain about how to move forward - particularly in her relationships with men. Anna and Arielle share with Frances some of their own experiences with sexual harassment in Hollywood. 

Then they play deal-breakers (58:30) and discuss the power of “the giggle."  (1:17:30). Finally, the gang calls Caitlin (1:32:30), whose best friend keeps dating married men. You definitely won't want to miss this one! 

BUY Anna’s book “Unqualified”: https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/unqualified/id1200307165?mt=11

item.title: ep 93: Mel Rodriguez/Anna and Sim's USC Podcast class with guest Paul Scheer
item.description:
It’s a brand new week, which means there’s a brand new episode of Unqualified! This week, Anna and Sim sit down with Anna’s Overboard co-star Mel Rodriguez (THE LAST MAN ON EARTH, GETTING ON). Anna and Mel discuss things that make Mel nervous (8:30), Mel’s college experience in New York (17:30), the video “Two Girls, One Cup” (23:30), and the time Mel was homeless (43:00). Then, Mel has to answer some dating deal-breakers for guys that might date his daughter in the future (59:30). Also, don’t miss Anna’s message to Will Forte (1:21:00)!

Later, the group call Mandie (1:23:00), who had a threesome with her husband and the other woman is now pregnant; and Angelica (1:50:00), who doesn’t know if she should let her step-dad walk her down the aisle.

For the second half of the episode, listen to a recording from Sim and Anna’s USC class with guest Paul Scheer (2:07:00)!

 

ALSO, Anna is going on a book tour!! Go to http://unqualified.com/booktour/ to learn more.

 

This episode is sponsored by Boll & Branch and Audible. Boll & Branch are the finest luxury bedding and tools at affordable prices. Audible is one of the largest producers of downloadable audiobooks in the world.

item.title: ep 92: Lee Daniels
item.description:
He’s the brain behind Cookie Lyon, Precious Jones, and Star Davis. Lee Daniels (EMPIRE, PRECIOUS, STAR) joins Anna and Sim on this week’s episode of Unqualified! In this episode, the Academy Award nominated director discusses narcissism (15:00), what is considered therapeutic (19:30), and why comedians make good dramatic actors (23:30). After Lee answers some deal-breakers (29:30), Anna auditions for a role in Empire (38:00). Get ready for a transformative performance!

Then, they call Bridget (52:00), who doesn’t know if she did the wrong thing by outing her friend to himself. What do you think she should do? Tune in!

item.title: Bonus! World Premiere: "Deadly Manners" starring Kristen Bell with intro from Rupaul.
item.description:
RuPaul, Michelle Visage, and Alex Aldea take over the

Unqualified feed to debut the world premiere of the Deadly Manners audio drama podcast.

 

Chapter 1

 

In the opening chapter of Deadly Manners we are introduced to Billings family and their esteemed guests. Everything is going swimmingly... until the power goes out.

 

Cast List:

 

Narrator - LeVar Burton

Veronica Billings - Kristen Bell

William Billings - Denis O'Hare

Olivia Billings - Alisha Boe

Esther Feinstein - Michelle Visage

Joseph Feinstein - Jason Sklar

George the Butler - Mark Berry

Beatrice the Maid - Elizabeth McLaughlin

Roger Clark - Timothy Simons

Nancy Clark - Anna Chlumsky

 

Written by Ali Garfinkel.

Directed by Alex Aldea.

Music composition (except for Jazz Piano Parts) by Alex Aldea.

Jazz Piano Parts were written and performed by Mark Rodriguez.

Foley and Sound Design: Victor Figueroa and Alex Aldea.

Editing by Alex Aldea, Victor Figueroa, and James Kim.

 

 

This episode is sponsored by AMC and SundanceNow.

item.title: ep 91: Jack Johnson
item.description:
Don’t let your dreams be dreams! The man with a voice that will make your heart melt, Jack Johnson (IN BETWEEN DREAMS, ALL THE LIGHT ABOVE IT TOO) is on this week’s episode of Unqualified!!! Anna and Sim sit down with the talented musician to learn about Jack’s favorite songs (9:00), how Jack handles a long lasting marriage (11:00), the making of the song “Bubble Toes” (14:00), and why Anna thinks women shouldn’t date musicians (22:00). Then, Jack answers some hard hitting deal-breakers (38:30) and performs his song “Sunsets for Somebody Else” (47:00).

Later, the gang call Jessie (58:30), who is hesitant to pursue any new friendships, and Christina (1:10:00), who is struggling to handle the fact that the guy she likes isn’t ready for a relationship. Finally, Jack ends the show with another one of his classics “Better Together” (1:22:00). Tune in!

This episode is sponsored by Le Tote and Icon Underwear. Le Tote is a monthly subscription service that provides various clothing from designer brands ready to wear. Icon Underwear is pee-proof underwear that keeps you dry and odor free.

item.title: ep 90: Elizabeth Olsen
item.description:
The beautiful and intelligent Elizabeth Olsen (WIND RIVER, INGRID GOES WEST) is on this week’s Unqualified! In this episode, Anna and Sim learn about the problematic shoot that resulted in the amazing Ingrid Goes West (9:00), Elizabeth’s thoughts on “tossing the salad” (10:20), and Anna’s experience taking mushrooms back in college (16:00). Next, Elizabeth answers some deal-breakers (18:00). Don’t ever call her “Lizzie Borden”!

item.title: ep 89: Lake Bell
item.description:
Omg! The talented writer/director/actress LAKE BELL (I DO… UNTIL I DON’T, IN A WORLD…) is on this week’s episode of Unqualified!! In this episode, Anna and Lake discuss starting a celebrity breast milk franchise (7:18), Lake’s experience while working on a Mark Duplass film (10:00), and Anna’s thoughts on a particular sex act (21:00). Then, Anna and Lake play the game “Celebrity Baby Name or Celebrity Restaurant/Bar” (27:00).

Later, they call Mallory, who is questioning whether her boyfriend’s job is too abnormal (41:00), and Elizabeth, whose boyfriend’s sister did something strange to her (57:00). This might be the wildest advice call Anna and Sim have ever received! Tune in!

Also make sure to check out Lake’s newest films!

“I Do… Until I Don’t” which she wrote, directed AND starred, and "Home Again"!

item.description:

item.title: ep 84: Mondo Cozmo
item.description:
Mondo Cozmo is in the house!!! On this week’s episode of Unqualified, Anna and Sim sit down with their good friend and musician Josh Ostrander (MONDO COZMO)! Anna and Josh discuss when Anna starred in one of his music videos (3:30) and how his career has recently started to skyrocket (3:50). Josh then dives deep into how he writes his music (17:00), and they ask some deal-breakers that Josh isn’t too judgmental about (31:00). Did we mention that Sim reveals how Unqualified was started? (51:00)

Later, they call Joyce (56:00), who completely forgot about her friend’s wedding! Throughout the episode, Josh plays some of his amazing tunes like “Shine” and ends the episode with his new song “Automatic” (1:15:00). Tune in!

And make sure to check out the new Mondo Cozmo album out on August 4th!

item.title: ep 83: Eva Longoria
item.description:
The iconic Eva Longoria (DESPERATE HOUSEWIVES, OVERBOARD) joins Anna and Sim this week for a great show! Right off the bat, Eva and Sim go back in time to talk about the movie they worked on together! The gang then discusses the importance of spirituality and humankind, what would happen if women ruled the world, and their favorite holidays! 
 
Eva is then put to the test when she’s asked some of Anna’s classic Deal-breakers. Find out what makes her tick! Then, during some How Would You Proceed’s, Eva has a run in with Johnny Depp himself! 
 
Anna and Eva then compete in a round of the “Celebrity Name Game” which challenges them to guess then name of commonly mispronounced celebrities names, something that happens to both of them.
 
They take a quick break and return to give some advice to Maria, whose boyfriend’s best friend drunkly admits his love for her, and Adina, whose friend owes her money and is causing quite a bit of drama! EVA LONGORIA! You don’t want to miss out!
This episode is sponsored by Blue Apron and Texture. Blue Apron is a meal delivery service that provides US residents with pre-portioned meals with recipes to subscribers. Texture is an app that provides unlimited access to over 150 magazine subscriptions for a monthly rate.

item.title: ep 82: Andy Cohen Returns! (And more caller updates!)
item.description:
Andy Cohen is back!!! On this week’s episode, Anna and Sim call Andy Cohen (WATCH WHAT HAPPENS LIVE WITH ANDY COHEN) to determine whether Anna would make a good Real Housewife (10:30), they put him in the hot seat to ask some loaded deal breakers including what he would do if asked about Anderson Cooper’s d**k (19:00), they discuss how to handle high pressure Hollywood game-nights plus the time Anna ended up crying in Kate Hudson’s bathroom (30:00), then finally, they turn the tables on Andy with a round of "Plead the Fifth" (35:00)! Later, they do some caller updates! First up is, Jackie (55:00) from our RuPaul episode (Ep. 58 at 1:11:55). Did she end up telling the guy she met on Bumble that she knew he was an NFL football player? Next they call Taylor (1:16:30), from the Chris Evans episode (Ep. 17 Pt. 2 at 49:20), who was contemplating traveling around the world in a camper with her husband. Did she pack up and hit the road? Tune in to find out!

This episode is sponsored by Le Tote and Helix Sleep Mattresses. Le Tote is a monthly subscription service that provides various clothing from designer brands ready to wear. Helix Sleep Mattresses are mattresses customized for your sleeping preferences. 

Check out our offers!

For 50% off your first month of Le Tote, visit letote.com and use promo code: UNQUALIFIED

item.title: ep 81: "The Lost Tapes Vol. 2" with Regina Hall and Tiffany Haddish!
item.description:
PSA to our dear listeners! We’ve got another special episode for you this week packed with never before heard recordings from two hilarious guests, Tiffany Haddish and Regina Hall, the stars of the movie Girls Trip out July 21st! In “The Lost Tapes Vol. 2”, Tiffany Haddish (GIRLS TRIP, THE CARMICHAEL SHOW) discusses how she conquered bullies growing up (3:30) and shows Anna and Sim the new “gadget” she bought on Amazon (12:30)! Then, they call Hilary, whose fiancé’s family makes her feel like an outsider (27:00) and Tiffany teaches the group a new word (54:00). Later, Regina Hall (GIRLS TRIP, SCARY MOVIE), Anna, and Sim talk to Chrissy, who is struggling with the fact that she isn’t into relationships (1:06:00). Tune in and enjoy!

Later, Regina Hall (GIRLS TRIP, SCARY MOVIE), Anna, and Sim talk to Chrissy, who is struggling with the fact that she isn’t into relationships (1:06:00). Tune in and enjoy!

item.description:
Attention dear listeners! We’ve got a very special episode for you this week loaded with never before heard recordings from past guests! In “The Lost Tapes Vol. 1”, the show is opened with a song by Eli Braden (Howard Stern Show), just before Anna and Sim go back in time, pre-Unqualified, to practice giving advice to a caller named “Lewis” (played by Chris Pratt) who accidentally slept with his cousin (6:00)! Then, they interview Justin Long (19:30) to discuss how he met Anna and to ask him some rapid fire questions (one word: anal?). Zachary Levi takes a meeting to brainstorm his next great role with the one and only, Karen Sarducci (41:20). Are Adam Pally and Zoe Lister-Jones ready to meet Kayla (50:30)? Find out what happens when Thomas Middleditch is approached by Chad, an app designer, who has an idea that's truly visionary (62:00)! Tune in and enjoy!

item.title: ep 79: Maria Bamford
item.description:
Maria Bamford (NETFLIX’s LADY DYNAMITE and OLD BABY) is here and she claims to have no deal breakers. Will she handle the questions Anna and Sim throw her way? On this episode, Anna discusses her parents' reactions to landing her first role in Scary Movie (9:00), Maria delivers a sneak peek of what she’ll say in her upcoming college commencement speech (11:00), and Jack Pratt makes another special appearance with his favorite movie quote (14:00)! 

Later, they call Tiffany (44:00), whose husband wants to move to LA and become an actor, and then Liana (58:00), whose long term boyfriend bought a wedding ring, but still hasn’t popped the question! Tune in and hang out!

item.title: ep 78: Live from Clusterfest with Hannibal Buress and Lizzo
item.description:
IT’S HERE! The legendary Hannibal Buress (BROAD CITY, THE ERIC ANDRE SHOW) and Lizzo join Anna and Sim on Unqualified's third live taping at Clusterfest! They talk about stand up, The Bachelor, and the time Hannibal threw himself a parade in New Orleans! Afterwards, Hannibal fields some Deal Breakers and "How Would You Proceed's?" before calling Melanie, who is nervous about seeing her brother's ex-wife for the first time in two years! The gang is then joined by another audience member, Emily, to give her LIVE advice about whether or not she should go on an all expenses paid trip to Vegas with an ex-boyfriend! Listen in and hang out!

item.title: ep 77: Nick Kroll
item.description:
Nick Kroll (OH HELLO, THE KROLL SHOW, THE LEAGUE) joins Anna and Sim for this week’s episode of Unqualified! They talk about what REALLY happens when you take on the New Orleans night life after the Super Bowl, fart etiquette with your significant other, and the importance of dating passionate people! After Jack makes a surprise appearance to try out some new jokes, Anna and Nick go head to head in a round of "Know Your Lines!" They then call Kelly, who finds out someone she's been casually seeing for two years has been in a long term relationship, and Katie, whose best friend unknowingly named her baby the same name she was planning on naming her own baby! Tune in! 

 

Nick Kroll: @nickkroll

Anna Faris: @annafaris

item.title: ep 76: Ari Graynor/Online Privacy and Revenge Porn Attorney Carrie Goldberg/Caller Updates!
item.description:
This week we’ve got a JAM PACKED episode of Unqualified for you! Up first, Anna and Sim talk to Carrie Goldberg, an attorney who specializes in online privacy and revenge porn. We then check in with some of our previous callers, Jeanine, who called about an affair she was having with a coworker, and Charlene, who was receiving anonymous notes at her desk! Then the gang is joined by the very talented Ari Graynor (I'M DYING UP HERE, WHAT'S YOUR NUMBER) to chat about double standards, snooping on social media and so much more! Listen in!

Anna Faris: @annafaris

Sim Sarna: @Simsarna

Ari Graynor: @Agraynor

item.title: ep 75: Adam Pally and Zoe Lister-Jones
item.description:
Adam Pally (MINDY PROJECT, HAPPY ENDINGS, MAKING HISTORY) and Zoe Lister-Jones (BAND AID, LIFE IN PIECES) join Anna and Sim on this week's Unqualified! Anna and Sim quickly catch up before the show starts and talk about Sarah Silverman's newest special! Shortly after, they join Zoe and Adam to talk about what it’s like working on set with only women, high school social rankings, and historical re-enactments! They then call Payton, who is unsure of what to do when she meets someone she has a strong connection with on an airplane, and Kyle, who is nervous about seeing an old flame at a weekend reunion! 

Tune in and make sure to check out Band Aid in theaters 6/2 and Sarah Silverman's Netflix special out 5/30! WOMEN RULE!

 

Unqualified: @unqualifed

Sim Sarna: @simsarna

Zoe Lister-Jones: @zoelisterjones

item.description:
This week on Unqualified, Anna and Sim sit down with the very kind, Eric Stonestreet (MODERN FAMILY, THE SECRET LIFE OF PETS, BAD TEACHER)! They talk about ghosting friends, anatomy, Eric's new show "The Toy Box" and how a broken heart got him to audition for his first play! They do a few Deal-Breakers then call Jack, who’s having issues with an aggressive ex, and Hannah, who’s boyfriend is embarrassed to introduce her to his parents because of her tattoos. Listen in and hangout!

The Toy Box premieres on FRIDAY, APRIL 7 8|7c, on ABC.

item.description:
HEY YOU! LISTENER! Have you heard the news? Unqualified Media is expanding by adding another hilarious show to your queue! Introducing "Missy and Zach Might Bang" starring Missi Pyle and Zach Selwyn! We have the first 20 minutes for you right here! These two are hysterical and are kicking off their season with the show’s producers, Anna and Sim! Tune in as they talk about robots, electro shock therapy, and The Matrix! Did we mention that they’ll also be improvising music throughout the entire show? HECK YEAH! To hear the full episode with it’s INSANE ending, subscribe to "Miss and Zach Might Bang” on iTunes now! For even more fun, episode 2 featuring Eric Stonestreet is also up! Go subscribe already!

The gang reminisces about college, dating now vs. the past, human evolution and what it’s like to work on multiple shows at once! After playing How Would You Proceed, Deal Breakers and Obscure Parenting Trivia they call Kate, who’s not sure what to do when someone she has a past with won’t stop reaching out even after proposing to his girlfriend, and Lindsey, who wants to know if she and her boyfriend are crossing the lines of comfort! Oh boy, it's a good one. Listen in!

item.title: ep 55: Zachary Levi
item.description: Happy Holidays from Unqualified! This week's guest is one of the kindest people in Hollywood: Zachary Levi (CHUCK, TANGLED, THOR)! In this episode, the gang covers everything from the rise and fall of stars, early careers, social media, and rejection. They also put Zach up to the test with some deal breakers and play a new game called “Name The Disney Mental Disorder!” Later, they call Haley, who’s on the fence about asking her boyfriend of a year to move across the country for her, and Meg, who’s nervous about attending a big work event because SMALL TALK IS THE WORST GUYS. Listen in and hang out with us!

item.title: ep 54: Jeremy Renner
item.description: WHAM! This week Anna and Sim sit down with America’s tough guy and Anna’s next door neighbor, Jeremy Renner (The Hurt Locker, Arrival, Avengers)! He gets the royal treatment at Imaginarium Studios where Hollywood legend Karen Sarducci pitches projects to him with heavy Oscar buzz. They also talk about the realities of fame and what's it's really like to be a working actor! Afterwards, the gang calls Kelsey, who needs advice on how to survive the holidays with a mother in law who doesn’t like her, and Laura, who’s boyfriend really loves football, maybe even a little too much. Listen in and hang out!

item.title: ep 53: Milo Ventimiglia
item.description: Secure your oxygen masks, tighten the yellow straps, and breathe slowly because this week our guest is the man, the myth...Milo Ventimiglia (This is Us, Gilmore Girls, Heroes). Karen Sarducci calls a meeting with the man everyone in town is talking about, and even gets her son Milo (played by Paul Scheer) on the phone so the two Milos can meet!  After some Unqualified deal-breakers, Anna, Sim, and Milo call Jenny, whose husband wants to get his PhD around the same time she wants to have kids.  They also give unqualified advice to Rachel, who doesn’t know what to do when a family she used to babysit for ropes her into the drama of an affair! Oh no! Turbulence! Tune in!

item.title: ep 52: Anna's Birthday w/ Jason Mantzoukas, Paul Scheer and June Diane Raphael
item.description: PODSWAP! In this week's episode, Anna and Sim sit down with the insanely funny hosts of the popular movie podcast HOW DID THIS GET MADE?, June Diane Raphael (Grace and Frankie, Ass Backwards), and Unqualified repeat guests Paul Scheer (The League, Fresh Off The Boat) and Jason Mantzoukas (The League, The Dictator)! June and Paul go on a double-date with Jason and his new girlfriend, Kayla, and take a meeting with the most powerful woman in Hollywood, Karen Sarducci! June and Paul also share the story of how they fell in love, and the gang calls Gabby who’s deciding whether to meet up with someone she’s met online. OH, AND DID WE MENTION IT’S ANNA’S BIRTHDAY? Don't miss the party!

item.title: Bonus Episode: Anna and Sim hire an intern
item.description: BONUS EPISODE: This week we go Inside Unqualified again as Anna and Sim sit down to interview a perspective intern named Nina! Both Anna and Sim ask the hard hitting questions about life, failures, and what it REALLY takes to be a an intern at Unqualified. What will happen when she shows up to the interview and Sim tells her Anna’s in a bad mood? Can she handle the pressure? Will she crack when Chris Pratt walks in? This 19 year old doesn’t know what’s coming so sit in on the interview and see if she gets the job.

Stakes are high this week, tune in!

item.title: ep 50: Andy Cohen/Caller Updates
item.description: This week's episode of Unqualified is extra special! Anna and Sim kick off the show with a call to Mr. Reality TV himself, the outrageously funny Andy Cohen (Watch What Happens Live)! Join in as the gang discusses three-ways and Andy shares how he almost lost his "gold star gay" status on a book tour.  Anna and Sim also dish out juicy deal breakers to Bravo's king of drama, and Andy talks about his new hilarious book “Superficial," which is in stores now! Then, Anna and Sim check in with previous callers to see how their unqualified advice panned out. They first follow up with Giovanni (Julia Stiles episode), who was contemplating whether to tell his family that he’s gay and living with his boyfriend. Next, they talk to Polly (Jason Mantzoukas episode), who decided to tell her conservative Christian parents that she’s in love with a Jewish man. Tune in and see how they're doing now!

item.description: In part two of this weeks Unqualified Anna, Sim and comedy Superhuman Seth Rogen (Superbad, Knocked Up, Sausage Party) take calls from Angel, who doesn’t know what to do about his relationship with a man who lied for three months about his identity, Stephanie, who's a law student that is recently divorced dealing with dating and her parents skepticism based on the past relationship, and Amy, who’s debating whether or not to date a guy her friend has a crush on. Plot twist HE WON THE BACHELOR!"

item.description: BONUS EPISODE: You heard right! At Unqualified we treat you right baby, and this week we're dropping a bonus episode with Writer/Producer Susan McMartin (MOM) who pulls back the curtain and lets us in the Hollywood writers room. Anna, Sim, Susan and Cassie talk about their careers in LA, selling scripts, getting started and what it’s like being a woman in a male dominated industry.

GUH, RELATABLE. The gang then caps off the show with some "Crazy Ex-Girlfriend" talk.

Dax also meets film studio head Karen Sarducci to discuss a Kung Fu movie with a very controversial title. Finally, Dax and Anna perform the opening scene of PRETTY WOMAN 2!

item.title: ep 45: Dax Shepard Pt. 1
item.description: Loveable goofball Dax Shepard joins Anna and Sim for another hilarious two-part Unqualified episode. Dax and Anna talk about a couples trip they took to Hawaii at the same time, Dax’s rise in Hollywood, and how men and women have different views on finding someone/being found naked. Dax even has the pleasure of meeting Kayla. The gang then breaks format and makes an early call to Megan, who is concerned about how her eight-month-old twins are affecting her marriage. More fun and another listener call tomorrow for Part 2! If you enjoyed the episode, we would really appreciate review on iTunes.

First, they call Jen, who’s caught in the middle of a scandalous workplace affair. Then, one lucky audience member, Devlin, joins the gang onstage to get advice on how make his new partner feel comfortable with physical intimacy. Next, they help Connie and her fiancé reach a compromise about 90's music at their wedding. Plus, Katie shares a super romantic story about her engagement ring.  

Check out Katie's podcast, Katie Couric, on iTunes.

item.title: ep 43: Katie Couric Pt. 1
item.description:
Katie Couric brings her warmth, wit, and wisdom to Unqualified this week. She and Anna delve into gender politics issues in journalism and Hollywood, and discuss Katie's work on a thought-provoking new documentary about gender identity. The conversation gets even more personal when Anna, Katie, and Sim discuss their experiences with internet trolls and cyber bullying. And you might be surprised about what Katie thinks are dating dealbreakers! The gang also plays a game called "Rapper or Politician?" and Katie teaches Anna a "valley girl" cheer (as well as correct Hebrew pronunciation).  

Join us tomorrow for Part 2, when Katie dishes about engagement ring and we hit the phones for some listener calls!

item.title: Ken Jeong Pt. 2
item.description: We're back for some calls and more improv in part 2! First, Anna, Ken, and Sim help Samantha decide whether to help keep her teenage daughter's lesbian relationship a secret from her daughter's girlfriend's strict Muslim parents. They also talk to Rebecca, who is unsure what effect her boyfriend starting medical school will have on their relationship. And prepare yourselves for Kayla's craziest Tinder date ever--with Mr. Chow from "The Hangover"!

item.title: ep 42: Ken Jeong Pt. 1
item.description:
Ken Jeong (DR. KEN, HANGOVER movies) is truly a national treasure. Listen in as Anna, Sim and Ken discuss Ken's remarkable transition from successful medical doctor to comedic superstar, and why practicing medicine is a lot like acting.  There is also another hysterical, improv-packed “Dealbreaker" series, and more #FYS than in any other episode to date. And sure to stay tuned til the end for a surprise finale!  

Join us tomorrow for more fun when we take some listener calls in Part 2!

item.title: Regina Hall Pt. 2
item.description: Part two of this week's episode has a little something for everyone! First, Anna and Regina discuss their early inspirations and explain why it takes thoughtfulness to play someone stupid or insane. The ladies then pitch a remake of "The Golden Girls"---and even improvise a scene from the show! Regina also educates Anna and Sim as to why the classic sitcom "Good Times" is the most frustrating show in history. From there, the gang turns to listener calls. They first talk to Carolyn, whose friends are becoming a little too involved in her relationship. Anna, Regina, and Sim then give Jen advice about how to disinvite her drunk sister-in-law to her upcoming wine tasting bachelorette weekend.

item.title: ep 41: Regina Hall Pt. 1
item.description: Happy holidays, from Fistgina, aka Anna Faris and her Scary Movie co-star Regina Hall (WHEN THE BOUGH BREAKS). Regina returns to Unqualified this week to reminisce with Anna about their Scary Movie days and even sing a few songs. (And yes, we explain what happened to Regina's first episode!)  Regina also describes her perfect penis for Anna and Sim, and the the gang discusses a promising new cure for constipation. They also play a hilarious round of “DealBreaker" with a new character: Chad. Then we’ll meet another new character named Sasha. Oh, and Kayla returns.

item.title: ep 40: Regina King
item.description: Regina King (American Crime, Southland, Jerry Maguire) reigns supreme on Unqualified this week. The 2015 Emmy winner and 2016 Emmy-nominated actress not only fields some of the most outrageous "Dealbreaker" questions to date (you'll never think of the name "Heather" the same way), but beats Anna handily in a game of "Football Player or Stripper" (same goes for "Lucious Pusey"). Regina and Anna also practice accepting Oscars on each other's behalf, read lines from a new stoner movie in a hilarious audition improv, and role-play a mother/daughter-in law having an unusual heart-to-heart. Later, Regina, Anna, and Sim talk to a newly-engaged woman whose fiancé's family remains inappropriately close with his ex-wife.

item.title: Johnny Galecki Pt. 2
item.description: The Unqualified crew calls in reinforcement from Chris Pratt to help out with some thorny issues this week.  First, they talk to a married woman who is struggling to break off an affair with her married colleague—even though she knows it is both wrong and reckless.  They then give some unqualified advice to a caller who has been secretly dating her BFF’s brother against her friend’s wishes.  Anna, Chris, Sim, and Johnny have lots of thoughts about whether and how she should break the news—tune in and find out what they have to say!

item.title: ep 39: Johnny Galecki Pt. 1
item.description:
Before this week's episode, Big Bang Theory's Johnny Galecki was a podcast virgin. Anna and Sim make sure that his first recording experience is a memorable one, complete with with Unqualified-style relationship hypotheticals and, of course, a Tinder date improv with Anna. In Part 1, Johnny also explains why he gets excited about criticism, what advice Roseanne gave him upon getting his role on Big Bang Theory, and the surprising reason he got into a fistfight with his brother on Christmas morning. Later, Anna and Johnny contemplate male vs. female sexual insecurity, and Johnny shares a hilarious story about dating a woman who did voodoo.  

Join us tomorrow for Part 2 when the gang (plus Chris!) hits the phone to dish out some unqualified advice.

item.title: Bonus Episode: ESPN Fantasy Football's Matthew Berry
item.description: Anna and Sim are gearing up for football season and need some advice about how to get their significant others to enjoy their first fantasy football seasons. So who better to call than ESPN fantasy football guru Matthew Berry? Listen in as Anna and Matthew strategize about how she can help Chris win his celebrity league--and beat out Chris Evans and John Krasinski! Matthew and Sim also discuss why women who aren't normally football fans (like Matthew's wife and Sim's girlfriend) should give fantasy football a chance. But don't worry, it's not all football talk! Anna and Sim put Matthew through the ringer with a "Relationship DealBreaker or Not: Football Edition," and find out that football statistics aren't all he's good at analyzing.  Enjoy!

item.title: Eric Andre Pt. 2
item.description: Carrie finds herself in an awkward situation: after scrolling through her boyfriend’s phone, she discovered some incredibly inappropriate texts. Her call to the Unqualified gang leads to a surprisingly thoughtful discussion on what constitutes “cheating.” Then, Anna, Sim, and Eric talk to Jessica, who is freaked out because the rich guy she’s currently dating may be too good to be true.  By the way, if at times you feel like you’re listening to a completely different Eric Andre, there is a reason for that. TWIDDLED MY BEAN! You’ll find out what that means as well!

item.title: ep 38: Eric Andre Pt. 1
item.description:
Eric Andre is one of the most innovative—and unpredictable—comedians today, so get ready for a wild ride. On this week’s episode, Anna, Eric and Sim discuss Anna’s fan mail to the band 311, Eric’s sexual encounter outside of a castle in Prague, Anna’s kegal breaks on the set of MOM, “Precious” in IMAX 3D, and much more. At the end of the episode, Eric is pressured into taking a bite of something gross—you won’t believe what it is! Join us back here tomorrow for Part 2 when we hit the phones; you’re not going to want to miss out on Eric’s unqualified advice!

 

Be sure to check out Eric on Adult Swim.  And if you really want to laugh, google “Eric Andre/Lauren Conrad” and “Eric Andre/RNC.”

At the end of the episode, Eric is pressured into taking a bite of something gross—you won’t believe what it is! You’ll have to hear Tavi’s story to believe it! No listener calls or games today, but we still find a way to fly off the rails.  So stay tuned til the end and enjoy!

And the last two minutes of the show may be our best ending yet - you've never heard Anna like this before! Enjoy!

item.description: Judging from all the feedback on social media, you all love Patti as much as we do!  Part Two is a little different; since Patti is our most “qualified” guest to date, we put her to the test. Two female listeners want to know why they can’t attract the men of their dreams…and boy does Patti let them know why! This episode may be a master class on what it really takes to have a fulfilling personal life. Whether you agree with Patti or not, prepare for some #truthbombs!

item.title: ep 35: Patti Stanger Pt. 1
item.description:
Million Dollar Matchmaker Patti Stanger holds nothing back when she joins Anna and Sim this week. Patti takes Sim to task about buying his girlfriend a ring, and gives Anna some tough love "Million Dollar Matchmaker" style. She also weighs in on relationship deal-breakers, and trades juicy dating stories with Anna. Packed with tips on dating, sex, and general negotiating strategy, you won't want to miss a minute of this riotous episode!  

Come back tomorrow when the gang hits the phones for some unqualified advice.  And be sure to catch Patti on "Million Dollar Matchmaker" on WE tv.

And you'll definitely want to stay until the end to hear what Tatiana will do to her Emmy if she wins!

Please subscribe on iTunes, rate and leave us a review! We love you!

item.title: ep 33: Julia Stiles Pt. 1
item.description: "Bourne Ultimatum" star Julia Stiles joins Anna and Sim for this week's two-part episode of "Unqualified."  Listen in as Julia opens up about her musical ambitions, her pigeon phobia, and why baseball is "her valium."  Anna also recounts her mom's reaction to Scary Movie, and contemplates the many words for genitalia in the English language.  Lastly, Sim and Anna give Julia some off-the-wall hypos involving garden gnomes and the Mets.  You won't want to miss her answers!

item.title: ep 32: 2 Dope Queens' Phoebe Robinson
item.description: The outrageously funny Phoebe Robinson, host of "2 Dope Queens" and "Sooo Many White Guys," joins Anna and Sim this week, along with her friend, comedian Jamie Lee. The gang discusses topics including flight attendants, "Sex and the City," nightmare auditions, Anna's Oprah encounter, and Donald Trump!  Also, prior caller Katie (James Gunn episode, Part 2, 15:35 mark) calls in to give an update about the uncomfortable situation with her recently-discovered birthmother. Finally, Anna, Sim, Phoebe and Jamie try to help a listener who is worried about her brother's gold-digging fiancé.

item.title: Bonus episode: Inside Unqualified
item.description: We have a special treat in store, dear listeners! Introducing the first episode of "Inside Unqualified," an experimental bonus show that we're trying out in addition to the show you heard this week. Sim hosts a roundtable discussion with Unqualified "insiders," including his girlfriend, Amy; close friends/former musical guests Aria Pullman Ostrander and Josh Ostrander (who wrote and sang the “Unqualified" theme song); and Anna and Sim's longtime friend, actress Alexandra Holden. The gang relives some of their favorite Unqualified moments so far and calls one of the most loyal Unqualified fans to get her take. Sim also shares some behind-the-scene stories, including the lead-up to Jennifer Lawrence and Chris Pratt's phone call on the first Aubrey Plaza episode, and what he and Amy observed while recording the Chris Evans and Jenny Slate episode. And while Anna isn't on the inaugural episode of "Inside Unqualified," trust us, she definitely feel the love!

item.title: Shane Dawson Pt. 2
item.description:
Have you recovered from the all the craziness that was Part 1? I know you've been patiently waiting a whole 24 hours for Part 2 and we're happy to say it doesn't disappoint! Anna, Sim and Shane hit the phones to help Emily, whose simple disagreement with a close friend has turned into something so much bigger. The gang also offers very sweet words of encouragement to Maria, who's nervous about losing her virginity next month on her wedding night! Oh, and Anna explains the science behind why her p###y is the "tightest in Hollywood." You don't want to miss this.

Did you like this episode? If so, please write a review on iTunes! We love you.

item.title: ep 31: Shane Dawson Pt. 1
item.description:
For all that YouTube sensation Shane Dawson talks about his "dark side," he's pretty f*cking hilarious. Nothing is off-limits when he stops by Anna's house for a riveting--and raunchy discussion--of topics including his recurring sexual nightmare and fantasy celeb sex tape participants. Later, Anna, Sim and Shane explore the ephemeral nature of celebrity, and Shane shares his unique perspective on digital media stardom. Anna also nails the role of Shane's mom in an improv scene that will have you laughing out loud. Oh, and we promise that after listening to this episode, you'll never look at ranch dressing the same way again!

Join the Unqualified gang tomorrow for Part 2 when we hit the phones for some listener calls!

Anna, Retta, and Aubrey dish out both tough love and hilarious advice in response.

item.title: ep 30: Aubrey Plaza & Retta Pt. 1
item.description:
Mini "Parks and Rec" reunion this week! Aubrey Plaza is back by popular demand, this time alongside fellow Parks and Recreation alums Retta and, of course, Chris Pratt. After recalling some hilarious behind-the-scene moments on the show, Aubrey shares her plan for terrifying children on Halloween and Chris posits a theory about the food court in heaven. Retta also keeps it real during an extensive discussion about whether porn is permissible in committed relationships. Plus, Anna takes the now-running studio executive improv game in a new direction - you won't want to miss it!

Be sure to tune in to Part 2 tomorrow when when Anna, Sim, and the Parks and Rec crew take calls from listeners.  And catch Aubrey's new movie, "Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates" out in theaters July 8th.

item.title: ep 29: Frank Grillo
item.description: Everyone's favorite tough guy Frank Grillo (Purge: Election Year, Captain America: Civil War) joins Anna and Sim for another can't-miss episode of "Unqualified." Frank shares how he went from being a Wall Street stockbroker to being an actor -- and what his hometown friends and Italian family thought about it. Anna and Frank also discuss ageism in Hollywood, loud lovers, and have an unforgettable exorcism voice-off.  The gang also plays a rousing new game: MMA Star or Porn Star?  Finally, they give advice to a caller who is uncomfortable about her colleagues' wild partying on business trips, and a woman who wants to disinvite her fiancé's best friend's (terrible) wife from her wedding. But the main takeaway from this episode? F*******ck thoooose d******cks.

item.title: ep 28: Keegan-Michael Key
item.description:
The uber-talented Keegan-Michael Key (Key & Peele, Keanu) joins Anna and Sim this week for another hilarious episode of Unqualified. Teeing off on themes from his new film "Don't Think Twice," Keegan and Anna offer reflections on fame, talent, success and providence. Keegan leaves no doubt that he's among the best improv performers in Hollywood when he and Anna revisit the studio-executive scenario from prior episodes.  His hysterical (and inspired!) pitches for sequels to Titanic and Rosemary's Baby are sure to have you in stitches! Later, they talk to a woman whose high school boyfriend, (the "one who got away") surprised her with a romantic -- yet ambiguous -- gesture nine years after their break-up. It's up to the Unqualified crew to deduce what he meant--and what her next move should be.

Be sure to catch Keegan in "Don't Think Twice" in theaters July 22nd!

item.title: James Gunn Pt. 2
item.description:
Buckle up "Unqualified" fans, because sh*t is about to get real.  In Part 2, James and Anna explore topics including sexual pressures imposed by society, fear of rejection, struggles with perfectionism, and what it means to be a leader. Later, James draws on his psychology degree even more when the gang calls a woman whose long-absent birth mother is suddenly seeking to reconnect.  Listen in as Anna and James help her grapple with complex family dynamics and questions of self-identity.

item.title: ep 27: James Gunn Pt. 1
item.description:
In the words of Chris Pratt, Guardians of Galaxy director James Gunn "runs deep." How did he get the GOTG gig? What inspired his vision for the franchise? And what in the world is a "bukaki"? James answers all these questions and more in Part 1 of this week's episode. Anna and James also bond over their competitive spirits, love of cream of wheat, and of course, their shared affection for Chris Pratt. And stay tuned 'til the end when Anna and James exchange outrageous Chat Roulette prank stories. Trust us, you'll be shocked!

Come back tomorrow for Part 2, when Anna, Sim, and James help a caller work through a tricky family situation.

item.title: Dave Bautista Pt. 2
item.description:
Dave Bautista continues to surprise and delight in Part 2 of this week's episode.  First, he, Anna, and Sim try to help a woman figure out the best way to propose to her long-term boyfriend.  The gang (along with surprise guest Chris Pratt!) then talks to a woman who is having trouble getting her boyfriend to clean up after himself.  Anna and Dave share their own cohabitation strategies; their advice may surprise you!  And be sure to stick around until the last five minutes when Chris revisits the goat-f*cking hypothetical posed to Dave in Part 1.  Trust us, this is one conversation you definitely won't want to miss!

item.title: ep 26: Dave Bautista Pt. 1
item.description:
For a total badass, former WWE star Dave Bautista (GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY (Drax), SPECTRE, upcoming BLADE RUNNER) sure is a nice guy. In this week’s two-part episode, Anna and Sim meet up with Dave in Atlanta, on location for GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY: VOLUME 2. Dave shares his remarkable journey from the streets of San Francisco, to the WWE ring, to the set of a blockbuster franchise—with a few stints in jail along the way! The gang also discusses life on the set of GOTG2, Dave’s all-time favorite workout playlist, and the wonder that is Japanese toilets. Later, they play a new WWE-inspired game, in which Dave must match famous wrestlers with their catch-phrases.  Dave even comes up with a wrestling name and signature move for Anna – you’ll never guess what it is!
 
We call listeners with advice for Part 2 tomorrow with special guest Chris Pratt! Be sure to tune in!

Credits:

item.title: ep 25: Anna Chlumsky
item.description:
Everyone knows that VEEP star Anna Chlumsky is charming and impressive. You might not know, however, that she is also a Star Wars super nerd, a Belgian beer connoisseur, and is extremely well-informed about digestive health. Anna shares all this and more when she joins Anna and Sim in this week's episode.  Listen in as both Annas and Sim talk about male vs. female gold-diggers, weird pregnancy cravings, and the importance of following one's instincts. They also play a hilarious new game: Politician or Real Housewife? Finally, the girls try to help a pregnant woman figure out how to handle her judgmental and competitive mom friends.

Credits:

item.title: Paul Scheer Pt. 2
item.description:
Part 2 picks up with calls from two Unqualified listeners in need of relationship advice. First, Anna, Sim and Paul talk to a woman whose husband is a terrible gift-giver.  Listen in as Paul enlightens her about the "Languages of Love" and the gang brainstorms about how to point him in the right direction. Next, they call Brittany, a woman who has been involved for six months with a stand-up comedian she met on a dating app. Paul and Anna leave no stone unturned in trying to help her figure out whether she likes him enough to commit to a possible long-distance relationship and, if so, how to talk to him about their relationship...as illustrated through another hilarious role-play. Their advice may or may not be good, but one thing is for sure: Brittany's boyfriend is going to be in a state of shock by the time he finishes listening to this episode!  

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Don't forget -- new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 24: Paul Scheer Pt. 1
item.description:
Actor/Comedian and Improv genius Paul Scheer (The League, Fresh Off the Boat, “How Did This Get Made?” podcast) stops by Anna’s house this week for another hilarious two-part episode. Picking up where his podcast co-host/prior Unqualified guest Jason Mantzoukas left off, Paul and Anna role-play a scene in which an ebullient screenwriter (Paul) must come up with plots for hilarious movie titles proposed by his studio executive boss (Anna). Later, Paul offers everything from conversation etiquette tips to unforgettable impressions, including Batman auditioning for an erectile dysfunction drug commercial and Indiana Jones passing out samples at Costco. Anna also shares the story behind the Unqualified cover photo and practices her sales pitch for chicken nuggets. Plus, Paul brings an item that Sim describes as the “weirdest thing [they’ve] ever had on the show.” You’ll never guess what it is! And be sure to tune in tomorrow when the gang hits the phones to dish out relationship advice!  
Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Don't forget -- new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: Chelsea Handler Pt. 2
item.description:
Chelsea Handler. Anna Faris. Marijuana-infused lubricant (yes, that’s a thing). Need we say more? Join in the fun in Part 2 of this episode, as Chelsea and Anna get a new -- and unusual -- kind of buzz. The gang then hits the phones to dish out some unqualified advice. First, Anna, Sim and Chelsea offer some tough love to a woman concerned that her sister is set to marry a guy she met just two months ago, despite NUMEROUS red flags.  Then, the gang tries to help a caller figure out what to do after she finally made out with her long-time crush…but he hasn’t spoken to her for two months since. Anna and Sim share their perspectives, but Chelsea makes a strong case for a bolder approach -- see who you think is right!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget -- new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 23: Chelsea Handler Pt. 1
item.description:
Chelsea Handler is unfiltered, unapologetic and unlike anyone else. The comedian/talk show host joins Anna and Sim this week, bringing to bear her acerbic wit and take-no-prisoners approach to love and life. In Part 1 of this two-part episode, Chelsea explains why she hates compliments, terms she finds most offensive and what exactly it takes to be her friend. She and Anna also trade break-up stories (you won’t believe how ballsy Chelsea is!) and discuss other dating misadventures. Then, in a new segment, Sim gives Anna and Chelsea twenty guesses to identify a mystery celebrity guest-caller. (See if you can figure out who it is before they do!) After Anna’s unbridled excitement subsides, the trio reflects upon the “intoxicating” effect of fame and the ups and downs of life in the Hollywood spotlight.  
 
Be sure to tune in tomorrow for Part 2 – you definitely won’t want to miss the surprise gift that Anna and Sim have in store for Chelsea!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 22: Tiffany Haddish
item.description:
Tiffany Haddish tells it like it is. The breakout star of “Keanu” joins Anna and Sim this week, showcasing both her incredible comedic talents as well as her astounding personal resilience. Tiffany opens up to Anna about her journey from the “hood” to the Hollywood red carpet, discussing how she was shaped by her experience in the foster care system and how she found the strength to pursue—and accomplish—her dreams against all odds. As outrageously funny as she is inspiring, Tiffany also has Anna and Sim in stitches throughout the episode as she talks about her friends, family, and her plan to sell a “special” hair growth product on QVC. And you definitely won’t want to miss Tiffany’s brilliant – and explicit – advice to Anna about how to communicate with men! Finally, the gang talks to a caller whose best friend declined to attend her birthday getaway weekend—even after her husband offered to buy her BFF’s ticket. Not sure she was ready for the advice that Anna and Tiffany dished out!


Credits:

item.title: ep 21: Britt Robertson
item.description:
Rising star Britt Robertson (MOTHER'S DAY, TOMORROWLAND, THE LONGEST RIDE) joins Anna and Sim for another fun-filled episode of “Unqualified.” Anna, Britt and Sim discuss why actors tend to date other actors and why becoming a yoga instructor is the most sure-fire way to marry someone rich—regardless of whether you’re male or female! Anna also describes her fantasy sleepaway camp and asks Britt “not-so-rapid-fire” questions involving jail, cliff-diving, and a man named Hudson. Plus, the gang helps a female caller decide whether to tell her friend that her boyfriend cheated on her with another friend in their social group! And stay tuned till the end -- with Mother’s Day just around the corner, you won’t want to miss Anna’s words of wisdom about motherhood!

Catch Britt in MOTHER'S DAY in theaters now!

And Mondo Cozmo's "Hold On to Me", a beautiful music video starring Anna can be seen here.

item.title: ep 20: Jason Mantzoukas
item.description:
Jason Mantzoukas (The League, The Dictator, Sleeping With Other People) is one of the funniest guys in Hollywood. His madcap energy is on full display when he joins Anna and Sim for this week's episode of "Unqualified." Among other memorable moments, Jason shares an outrageous story about how one unfortunate incident forever changed his "laissez-faire attitude towards farting." Anna and Jason also showcase their improv skills by role-playing a scene in which a stoner college drop-out (Jason) applies for a job as the second assistant to a powerful movie studio executive (Anna). The gang also handles some tricky calls this week. First, they talk to a caller whose gay BFF set her up with a man who he himself has a crush on. Then, Jason and Anna have a heart-to-heart with a woman whose family disapproves of her dating a Jewish man. Sim can barely contain his laughter throughout this mile-a-minute episode – and we’re pretty sure you won't be able to either!

Credits:

Anna and Jason also showcase their improv skills by role-playing a scene in which a stoner college drop-out (Jason) applies for a job as the second assistant to a powerful movie studio executive (Anna). The gang also handles some tricky calls this week. First, they talk to a caller whose gay BFF set her up with a man who he himself has a crush on. Then, Jason and Anna have a heart-to-heart with a woman whose family disapproves of her dating a Jewish man. Sim can barely contain his laughter throughout this mile-a-minute episode – and we’re pretty sure you won't be able to either!

Credits:

item.title: ep 19: Shaquille O'Neal
item.description:
Shaquille O'Neal may very well be Anna Faris's biggest fan -- both literally and otherwise! The mutual excitement is palpable as Shaq welcomes "his Anna" and Sim to Atlanta in this can't-miss episode. Inspiring, insightful, and inimitable, the larger-than-life NBA star recounts how he got the courage to ask out his high school crush and admits which NBA team he'd refuse to play for based on its mascot. Sim and Anna also put Shaq to the test by making him match rap lyrics to the NBA baller who rapped them. Later, the gang gives a male caller unqualified advice about how to help re-build his wife's self-confidence after years of marriage and child-raising have taken a toll. "ShaqDaddy's" advice is bound to make you love him even more! And speaking of love, Shaq manages to make both Sim and Anna blush in this episode -- stay tuned 'til the end to find out why!

Credits:

item.title: Olivia Munn Pt. 2
item.description:
Olivia Munn is back in full force -- literally! In this action-packed segment, she whips out a 900,000 volt stun gun...and Sim nearly shoots himself! Olivia and Anna also delve into the complexities of female friendship, and discuss Olivia's first kiss -- a makeout session that lasted the entirety of Forrest Gump! Olivia even inspired a new game: Match the Hollywood Celeb to Her NFL Paramour. (We won't say who wins!) Finally, the crew gives unqualified advice to a busy twenty-three year-old EMT whose married friends make her feel badly about being single. Trust us, by the time you finish Part II of this episode, you'll wishing there was a Part III!

item.title: ep 18: Olivia Munn
item.description:
Olivia Munn truly is every guy's dream girl. Beautiful, brilliant, and funny as hell, the self-described "Prince Harry of Maxim" joins Anna and Sim for this week's two-part episode. Join in on the fun as Olivia and Anna discuss Olivia's desire to hold a baby panda, her deep-seated fear of brain-eating amoebas, and her search for the truth about post-baby vaginas. Olivia also explains why she froze her eggs, and (jokingly) offers to be Anna's surrogate. But don't worry, guys, there plenty of football talk too, as one might expect from the girlfriend of NFL MVP Aaron Rodgers. Anna and Olivia even role-play a conversation about football between Chris Pratt and Anna -- with Anna playing Chris! You won't want to miss this mile-a-minute episode.

And be sure to tune in tomorrow for Part II when the gang hits the phones for some unqualified advice!

Olivia Plays Psylocke in X-Men: Apocalypse in theaters May 27th!
Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.description:
Did you listen to the awesomeness that was Part 1 yet? If not, go back and listen...you won't be disappointed. We go to the phones for Part 2 where Anna, Sim, Chris Evans, and Jenny Slate are joined by Chris Pratt! The gang tackle three calls: Cait is hurt that her male best friend is marrying his girlfriend and this girlfriend disapproves of their platonic friendship, Ashley doesn't want to be the cause of a broken engagement and finally a woman is about to embark on a three-year adventure driving around the world with her husband in a 50 square foot camper...she's concerned about spending TOO much time alone together.

item.title: ep 17: Chris Evans and Jenny Slate
item.description:
Get ready for the ultimate Unqualified double-whammy! Captain America himself, Chris Evans, and Jenny Slate (Obvious Child, Parks and Rec) join Anna and Sim for a night of hilarious antics and unforgettable banter. This special two-part episode doubles down on everything you love—two sets of male/female BFFs, two brilliant comedic actresses, and even two superheroes named Chris! In Part 1, Anna, Sim, Jenny, and Chris Evans talk candidly about making friends in Hollywood, personal grooming habits, and the pressure to look great in the digital age. Plus, Chris and Anna improvise an absurd traffic stop, Jenny discloses who her (unconventional) celebrity crush is, and the crew re-casts “Three Men and a Baby” with Captain America, Star-Lord and Iron Man. And you won’t want to miss the answer to one of life’s burning questions: is Chris Evans a “boob” or “butt” man?

Don’t forget to tune in tomorrow for Part 2, when Chris Pratt joins the gang to dish out some unqualified relationship advice!

Captain America: Civil War is in theaters May 6th!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

Credits:

Co-host and Produced by: Sim Sarna @simsarna Twitter and IG
Technical Producer: Mike Flinn @realmikeflinn

item.title: ep 16: Jack and Karen Faris/Alison Rosen
item.description:
We have a special two-part episode for everyone today. For part one, Anna is joined by her amazing parents, Jack and Karen Faris! Listen in, as they share the hilarious and poignant story of their storybook romance...a romance that's lasted over 48 years! For the second part, Anna and Sim are joined by popular podcast host, Alison Rosen (Alison Rosen is Your New Best Friend). Anna, Alison and Sim discuss the liberating feeling of having a podcast, "going out" in Los Angeles and Anna's love for Mike "The Situation" Sorrentino! Finally, the trio help a female caller decide if it's time to give her longtime boyfriend the ultimatum.

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 15: Melissa Benoist
item.description:
SUPERGIRL herself, Melissa Benoist joins us on one of our most entertaining episodes to date! Anna, Melissa and Sim a wide variety of topics including Melissa’s first kiss, disdain for the term “preggers” and the brilliance that is THE NEVERENDING STORY. We also introduce a new segment called “Thank You For Bringing Something Weird…What Is It?” You will not believe the value of one of the items! Needless to say, Melissa left the house a VERY surprised and VERY happy woman. Plus a female caller’s roommate is dating her ex-boyfriend’s identical twin brother – and she can’t move on because she sees her ex’s clone everyday at the apartment! This call leads to Anna and Sim's first on-air argument about...of all things, “twin fantasies.” Finally, a male caller needs advice on his pending marriage proposal to his longtime girlfriend! DO NOT SKIP THIS EPISODE!
Be sure to catch Melissa on SUPERGIRL, Mondays at 8PM on CBS!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 14: Jenna Dewan Tatum
item.description:
The dazzling Jenna Dewan Tatum (STEP UP, SUPERGIRL) stops by Anna’s house in this lively episode! Jenna shares her favorite show to binge watch and how she fights off assailants in her dreams. Anna, Jenna, and Sim also dish about Channing Tatum and Chris Pratt’s bromance, getting recognized at the grocery store and Anna’s brilliant performance in JUST FRIENDS. Jenna also teaches Anna a few dance moves—with stripper shoes on! (Check out the video on our Facebook and Twitter!) The gang then gives unqualified advice to a woman with concerns about dating “casually,” and tries to help a bride-to-be decide whether her passion for cats is a relationship deal-breaker. Anna’s hubby also pops his head in to weigh in on a call. You DO NOT want to miss his revealing and hilarious advice!
Subscribe on iTunes and leave us a review. And don’t miss Jenna on SUPERGIRL, Mondays at 8PM on CBS!

item.title: ep 13: Missi Pyle & Zach Selwyn
item.description:
Missi Pyle (The Artist, Gone Girl) and Zach Selwyn (America's Secret Slang) join Anna and Sim for an "Unqualified" episode unlike any other. Join in as the gang plays a hilarious new guessing game called "Fake or Florida." They also discuss dating multiple people with the same first name and the pros and cons of telling a romantic partner about being hit on by someone else. Zach also spills about what happened when he and his wife spent a week on Tinder as an experiment. (Spoiler alert: it almost ruined their marriage!) Anna, Zach, Missi, and Sim also talk to a listener whose husband refuses to help her with the kids and household chores. You won’t want to miss the solution Anna and Missi propose! And stay tuned ‘til the end for Zach's legendary freestyle rap!

item.title: ep 12: Ellen Page
item.description:
Ellen Page is every bit as brilliant and cool as you've heard. The Oscar-nominated actress hangs out with Anna and Sim in this week's Episode, discussing Ellen's experience eating dog food, Anna's knowledge of Canadian provinces, and why it's Anna's dream to become a flight attendant. Ellen also talks about her new docu-series, GAYCATION, which literally moved Anna to tears. And you won't want to miss this week's calls! First, the gang offers unqualified advice to a woman who still has intense feelings for her first love...with whom she happens to work...even though she's engaged to another man and just had a child with him! They also help a male caller decide whether to bring a date to a wedding where he'll see his longtime crush with her new boyfriend! And you won't want to miss what Anna blurted out at a McDonald's outing with Chris! This episode is a MUST listen!

item.title: ep 11: Lisa Kudrow
item.description:
In this week’s episode of “Unqualified,” the gang welcomes a long-time FRIEND: Lisa Kudrow!  Listen in as Anna and Lisa reminisce about Anna’s guest-starring role on the final season of FRIENDS.  Then, in the most off-the-wall “Rapid Fire” series yet, Anna and Lisa deliberate about whether an Emmy or a SAG Award trophy is the deadlier weapon.  Anna, Sim, and Lisa also talk to a woman who wants to know whether she should remain friends with a man for whom she has feelings, or whether it is time to move on.  And our last caller made Anna giddy with excitement—tune in to find out why! 

 

 

Credits:

item.content:encoded:
In this week’s episode of “Unqualified,” the gang welcomes a long-time FRIEND: Lisa Kudrow!  Listen in as Anna and Lisa reminisce about Anna’s guest-starring role on the final season of FRIENDS.  Then, in the most off-the-wall “Rapid Fire” series yet, Anna and Lisa deliberate about whether an Emmy or a SAG Award trophy is the deadlier weapon.  Anna, Sim, and Lisa also talk to a woman who wants to know whether she should remain friends with a man for whom she has feelings, or whether it is time to move on.  And our last caller made Anna giddy with excitement—tune in to find out why!

item.title: ep 10: Jaime Pressly
item.description:
Emmy-winning actress Jaime Pressly brings her Southern charm and wit to this week's episode of "Unqualified." Tune in for some serious girl talk as Anna and Jaime dish about the pros and cons of dating rich men, "mom guilt," and how men and women act differently in relationships. Plus, Anna, Sim, and Jaime give unqualified advice to a woman who feels the men she dates are terrified by her age---of 33!   Anna and Sim also check back in with Thomas from Edmonton (a caller from the Aubrey Plaza episode) who fell really hard for a visiting Australian woman with a boyfriend back home. Did Thomas take the gang's advice? Find out!

item.title: ep 09: Adam Carolla
item.description:
Adam Carolla brings his signature style (and signature cocktail!) to "Unqualified" this week. Blunt, unapologetic, and always entertaining, Adam proves why he's been captivating audiences for fifteen years. Listen in as Adam and Anna spar over men's dating preferences, and discuss secrets for self-confidence. Adam also shares a hilarious story about the funniest prank ever pulled on him.  Later, he brings his Love Line skills to bear when he, Anna, and Sim talk to Unqualified listeners, including a woman whose husband has an unconventional sexual request, and a girl who wonders how to tell a former fling that she is moving to his city. You won't want to miss a moment of this feisty, fast-paced episode. So pour yourself a glass of Adam's "Mangria" and join in the fun! 
 
And be sure to catch Adam Carolla on his own legendary podcast, THE ADAM CAROLLA SHOW 
 
Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 08: Lance Bass
item.description:
Anna’s long-time friend Lance Bass joins her and Sim in this earnest and entertaining episode of “Unqualified.” Among other hilarious moments, Lance and Anna discuss Washington's thriving topless coffee-hut scene, assumptions made about Southerners, Lance’s early days as a boy-bander, and who he would cast to play him in the movie version of his life. The conversation also takes a more serious turn when Lance shares his struggles in coming out to his family and friends (including his band-mates in *NSYNC!). The gang gives plenty of unqualified advice too, this time to a woman who may or may not be in love with her platonic best friend, and a gay man whose straight college buddies are pressuring him to stay in the closet. And speaking of unqualified, Lance helps a woman understand why she is so annoyed with her boyfriend’s quirks—by diagnosing her with a medical condition! This episode is jam-packed. Enjoy!
 
 
Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!
 
Credits:
 
Co-host and Produced by: Sim Sarna @simsarna
Technical Producer: Mike Flinn @realmikeflinn
Social Media and Co-producer: Alycia Lancey @alycialancey
Theme song by: Mondo Cozmo @mondocozmo
Website by: Will Plyer
Twitter: @unqualified
IG: @unqualified 
Follow Anna at @annakfaris
