item.title: ep 07: Ike Barinholtz
item.description:
In this week’s episode, Anna and co-host/producer Sim Sarna are joined by Ike Barinholtz, the hilarious, scene-stealing star of “The Mindy Project,” “Sisters,” “Neighbors” and more. Listen in as Ike and Anna compare 80’s crushes, discuss magicians’ sexual prowess (or lack thereof), and role-play awkward date scenarios. Ike also shares his most embarrassing date moment: the night he met his now-wife’s parents! Later, the gang tries to help a female listener cope with her fiance's declining sex drive. And be sure to stay tuned until the end of the call, when Ike asks his own question – and gets a very unexpected answer. We’re sure you’ll laugh as hard as we did!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 06: Michael Rapaport
item.description:
Michael Rapaport is not only an incredibly talented and respected actor...he's also adorably insane! Listen in as Anna and Michael go "toe-to toe" in their first meeting and discuss how Wikipedia pages can negatively affect lives, why women who know how to dive into swimming pools are sexier and how reality TV is similar to the UFC. In a hilarious exchange, Anna also refuses to let Michael live down the STD he may or may not have contracted back in high school! You'll also hear them role-play a bar "pick-up" scene and share a crazy story about a woman Michael dated who slept with two very high profile athletes from the same team. (You'll have to listen to find out who!) The gang also helps callers dealing with threesome etiquette and "bro-code." Enjoy!


Be sure to catch Michael on I AM RAPAPORT: STEREO PODCAST

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! Anna loves reading them. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

Credits:

Technical Producer: Mike Flinn @realmikeflinn

item.title: ep 05: Aubrey Plaza
item.description:
You're in for a real treat today! In this week's episode of "Unqualified," Anna and cohost/producer Sim Sarna welcome one of the most unique comedic talents in Hollywood: the one and only Aubrey Plaza! Listen as they discuss Andy and April's relationship from "Parks and Rec," and Aubrey's audition for "Star Wars." Among other hilarious moments, Anna and Aubrey consider their preferred murder weapons and why mens' balls smell like stale cheerios. The gang also calls two of their movie star friends for an uncensored conversation that's sure to have the internet buzzing! (Hint: they're co-stars in an upcoming movie.) Later, Anna, Sim and Aubrey offer unqualified advice to a woman having trouble navigating shared friends post-breakup, and try to help a man hopelessly in love with a woman who's about go back home to Australia...where she has a boyfriend. YOU DO NOT WANT TO MISS THIS EPISODE!

And be sure catch Aubrey in DIRTY GRANDPA (co-starring Zac Efron and Robert De Niro) opening nationwide January 22nd!

Please rate us on iTunes and leave us a review! We'd love to hear from you. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: ep 04: David Krumholtz
item.description:
David Krumholtz (Numb3rs, THE SANTA CLAUSE, and countless other movies/TV shows) joins Anna and co-host/producer Sim Sarna in this side-splittingly funny episode. An unexpected internet outage means there aren’t any listener calls in this episode, but David more than makes up for it with his hilarious insights into the male mind. He recounts how he began to date his now-wife on the heels of a tough breakup when he was just 25 years old and purposefully NOT looking for love. Anna and David also share their views on older men dating much younger women. Plus, the gang plays a hysterical—and raunchy—round of "Would You Rather." WARNING: some of the answers may shock you…but you’re bound to be entertained!

If you enjoy this episode as much we hope you do, we’d love to hear from you! Please rate us on iTunes and let us know how much you like the show. Thanks, and don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

item.title: Christmas Bonus
item.description:
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays to all of our loyal "Unqualified" listeners! We have a special treat for you today: "Anna Faris is Unqualified" theme song performer/writer Josh Ostrander (@MondoCozmo) and his wife Aria Pullman Ostrander(@ariapullman) join Anna and cohost/producer Sim Sarna to belt out some of Anna's favorite Christmas songs...including a hilarious version Blue Christmas featuring the lyrical freestyle stylings of Anna as Elvis Presley! And this episode is not all music; hijinks and special surprises abound in this lean 20-minute bonus episode. Thank you all so much for making "Unqualified" among the most listened-to podcasts. We're beyond humbled. Now crank up the volume on your phone, computer, bluetooth speaker or car and sing along!

item.title: ep 03: Judah Friedlander
item.description:
The "World Champion" is in the building! On another uproarious episode of "Unqualified," Anna and producer/co-host Sim Sarna welcome comedian and "30 Rock" star Judah Friedlander! The trio compare dating in Los Angeles with dating in New York, and Judah explains why he prefers foreign porn to American porn. Anna and Judah also discuss marketing a "reverse Viagra" pill that women could “prescribe” to men who cheat! They also give (unqualified) advice to a male caller about how to rebound from his terrible ex-girlfriend and reenter the dating world with confidence, and talk to a female listener who can't stand the fact that her best friend keeps getting back together with her cheating boyfriend!

If you enjoy this episode as much we hope you do, we’d love to hear from you! Please rate us on iTunes and let us know how much you like the show. And don't forget - new episodes release every Tuesday!

And pick up a copy of Judah's new book of drawings and cartoons called "If the Raindrops United." Available online and in bookstores now!

item.title: ep 02: Rosie O'Donnell
item.description:
Anna and producer/co-host Sim Sarna welcome the one and only Rosie O'Donnell! Join Anna and Rosie for a hilarious discussion about their awkward celebrity encounters, kissing Allison Janney, and how Rosie became close friends with Madonna at the height of her fame when the two filmed “A League of Their Own.” Then, in a surprise twist, Rosie takes a call from the supremely talented Aubrey Plaza (Parks and Rec). Aubrey shares how Rosie’s biography gave her the courage to become a Hollywood actress, and ultimately changed her life forever. Anna and Rosie also help a female liberal arts student with her issues dating “soft boys,” and talk to a young man who wonders if it’s okay to be a “prude” despite societal pressures to the contrary in the gay community. Listeners who think they know Rosie are bound to be very surprised by what she has to say. And if you love her already, we promise you’ll love her even more. Enjoy!

Credits:

Co-host and Produced by: Sim Sarna
Technical Producer: Mike Flinn
Social Media and Co-producer: Alycia Lancey
Theme song by: Mondo Cozmo
Website by: Will Plyer
twitter: @annafarispod
IG: annafarispod
facebook.com/annafarisisunqualified
Submit your questions to www.annafarisisunqualified.com

Rosie established Rosie’s For All Kids Foundation in 1997. The foundation raised more than $60 million and awarded more than $27 million dollars in grants to over 1,400 child-related non-profit organizations to benefit low-income families across the country. In 2003, Rosie established Rosie’s Theater Kids in order to provide a Broadway experience to children who might otherwise not have the opportunity.
Rosie’s Theater Kids (RTKids) is an arts education organization dedicated to enriching the lives of children through the arts. They serve students who otherwise would not have the opportunity to experience theater, positively changing the trajectory of their lives by providing comprehensive classes in music, dance and drama; thoughtful mentoring; and structured academic guidance.

Learn more and donate by visiting Rosie.com
item.content:encoded:
Anna and producer/co-host Sim Sarna welcome the one and only Rosie O'Donnell! Join Anna and Rosie for a hilarious discussion about their awkward celebrity encounters, kissing Allison Janney, and how Rosie became close friends with Madonna at the height of her fame when the two filmed “A League of Their Own.” Then, in a surprise twist, Rosie takes a call from the supremely talented Aubrey Plaza (Parks and Rec). Aubrey shares how Rosie’s biography gave her the courage to become a Hollywood actress, and ultimately changed her life forever. Anna and Rosie also help a female liberal arts student with her issues dating “soft boys,” and talk to a young man who wonders if it’s okay to be a “prude” despite societal pressures to the contrary in the gay community. Listeners who think they know Rosie are bound to be very surprised by what she has to say. And if you love her already, we promise you’ll love her even more. Enjoy!

Credits:

Co-host and Produced by: Sim Sarna Technical Producer: Mike Flinn Social Media and Co-producer: Alycia Lancey Theme song by: Mondo Cozmo Website by: Will Plyer twitter: @annafarispod IG: annafarispod facebook.com/annafarisisunqualified Submit your questions to www.annafarisisunqualified.com

Rosie established Rosie’s For All Kids Foundation in 1997. The foundation raised more than $60 million and awarded more than $27 million dollars in grants to over 1,400 child-related non-profit organizations to benefit low-income families across the country. In 2003, Rosie established Rosie’s Theater Kids in order to provide a Broadway experience to children who might otherwise not have the opportunity. Rosie’s Theater Kids (RTKids) is an arts education organization dedicated to enriching the lives of children through the arts. They serve students who otherwise would not have the opportunity to experience theater, positively changing the trajectory of their lives by providing comprehensive classes in music, dance and drama; thoughtful mentoring; and structured academic guidance. Learn more and donate by visiting Rosie.com

item.title: ep 01: T.J. Miller
item.description:
Episode 1 of “Anna Faris is Unqualified” found Anna and co-host/producer Sim Sarna barely able to contain themselves with laughter thanks to guests T.J. & his wife k8.
Listen as T.J. Miller, (the reigning Critics Choice Award winner for his role as Erlich Bachman on HBO’s hit show SILICON VALLEY) & his wife/muse k8 (artist RosePetalPistol), open up about their relationship, and share crazy stories along the way. Anna, T.J. and k8 also give callers hilarious—and definitely unqualified—advice about public sex, dating musicians, and holding on to grudges.

There’s a reason why T.J. Miller is widely considered one of the great comedic minds of this generation and we are the company he keeps.

Strap in for a wild one!

Follow them @nottjmiller and @rosepetalpistol"

Credits:

Co-host and Produced by: Sim Sarna
Technical Producer: Mike Flinn
Social Media and Co-producer: Alycia Lancey
Theme song by: Mondo Cozmo
Website by: Will Plyer
twitter: @annafarispod
IG: annafarispod
facebook.com/annafarisisunqualified
